intro: Achoriphragma turkestanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid to semi-arid environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Achoriphragma turkestanicum is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological significance.
